Articles.Content: So hello folks, as with most people who run a heavily modded ksp, i use -force-opengl. However i was wondering if anyone has tried out dx11/12 commands with windows 10 now, and if they have found it to be an improvement over the opengl command?
The unity game engine doesn't have any support for DirectX12 yet, so there is no command for it.

The commands have very little to do with Windows 7, 8, and 10. Direct X is an API package and the differences between them are additive, not replacements (i.e. Direct X 11 has everything in Direct X 9 plus some new stuff, there are a few rare exceptions though). However, though the API is the same, the way it executes the methods in the API has changed, which is why the performance is much better in Direct X 11 for the same task. Long story short, it is unlikely to see any significant difference between DX11 on Windows 7, 8, or 10.

As sal\_vager said, Unity has to 'know' about DX12 before it could even force it to be used, even if it does contain the same DX11 API calls.
